image.alt: Foster Orthodontics team and patients smiling in a bright, modern office

paragraphs.text: Since 1985, Foster Orthodontics has delivered patient-centered orthodontic care to children, teens, and adults across Shreveport, Bossier City, and Stonewall. Our team blends decades of experience with modern technology to create treatment plans that fit each patient.

We use digital scanning, 3D printing, diode lasers, and other advanced tools to improve comfort and precision. Complimentary consultations, insurance acceptance, and interest-free in-house financing help make care affordable and straightforward.

items.title: Modern Equipment
items.text: Digital scanners, 3D printing, and diode lasers deliver precise, comfortable care for faster, more accurate appointments.

items.title: Experienced Team
items.text: A father-and-son leadership plus Dr. Jason Cope and long‑tenured staff bring decades of clinical and teaching experience to every case.

items.title: Proven Treatments
items.text: We offer Damon System, Invisalign<sup>®</sup> and other clear aligners, plus traditional braces to match each patient’s goals.

items.title: Friendly Financing
items.text: Complimentary consultations, insurance acceptance, and interest‑free in‑house financing make care accessible and comfortable.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Benjamin E. Foster leads the practice alongside his son. Together they bring more than 60 years of combined orthodontic experience, guiding treatment choices that focus on long‑term results and patient comfort.

Dr. Ben Foster joined the practice in 2012. A graduate of LSU School of Dentistry, he completed his orthodontic residency at LSU and earned multiple academic awards. Dr. Ben focuses on evidence‑based care and enjoys working with patients of all ages.
Outside the office, Dr. Ben and his wife Allison enjoy family time with their daughters and supporting local community organizations.

Dr. Jason B. Cope brings decades of clinical, research, and teaching experience. He earned his dental degree, orthodontic certificate, and PhD in craniofacial bone biology from Baylor College of Dentistry and has published extensively and lectured internationally.
Dr. Cope’s clinical background and research experience support advanced treatment planning and predictable clinical results for complex and routine cases alike.
We provide modern options for every age, including clear aligners, self‑ligating braces, and traditional orthodontics. Schedule a consultation to learn which option fits your smile.

image.alt: Traditional braces on a smiling patient

testimonials.author: Jennifer C.
testimonials.testimonial: “The Fosters are amazingly calm, kind, knowledgeable, and treatment‑conservative orthodontists! The office staff goes above and beyond making visits a breeze.”

testimonials.author: Zandra A.
testimonials.testimonial: “Love love love!! They are always so sweet and patient! My daughter deals with anxiety and they make her feel so comfortable. Always explaining what's being done and welcoming any call or concern. They're the best!!”

testimonials.author: Scottie S.
testimonials.testimonial: “The technician was extremely thorough and kind, as were all the staff. We look forward to a better smile soon. I know we are in great hands at Foster Orthodontics.”

testimonials.author: Rebecca B.
testimonials.testimonial: “Foster Orthodontics is the best there is!! All of the staff members are friendly, knowledgeable, and personable... The office is very clean, comfortable, and fun! Make your appointment today…you won’t be disappointed!”

og_meta.title: Home - Foster Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Foster Orthodontics provides Damon, Invisalign®, and traditional braces with modern technology and family-centered care in Shreveport, LA.

paragraphs.text: At Foster Orthodontics, we are a family-oriented practice committed to delivering patient-centered care for children, teens, and adults. We combine long experience with modern technology to make treatment comfortable, efficient, and tailored to each person's needs.

Our team focuses on clear communication and a welcoming office experience so every visit feels simple and respectful of your time. We offer a full range of orthodontic options including braces, clear aligners, and advanced appliances to fit different lifestyles and goals.

We invest in proven technology and gentle techniques to improve treatment predictability and patient comfort. From digital scans to efficient appointment scheduling, our goal is to give you a healthy, confident smile with as little disruption to your routine as possible.
For questions or to request an initial appointment, call (318) 750-2762 or use our online contact form to schedule a visit.

Ben C. Foster, DDS, joined the practice in 2012. A lifelong Shreveport resident, Dr. Ben provides thoughtful, patient-centered orthodontic care for children, teens, and adults, focusing on predictable results and a comfortable experience.

image.alt: Dr. Ben Foster smiling in office

paragraphs.text: Dr. Ben studied biology at Louisiana State University before earning his dental degree at LSU School of Dentistry. He completed his orthodontic residency at LSU. His honors include the Baldridge Dental Scholarship, the William Kramer Award of Excellence, membership in C. Edmond Kells Honor Society and Omicron Kappa Upsilon, and the 2008 ADA Densply Student Research Program award.

Dr. Ben’s specialty is orthodontics, offering braces, clear aligner therapy, and contemporary systems like Damon for efficient, comfortable treatment. At home he and his wife Allison enjoy family life with their daughters, support LSU sports, and contribute to local causes including Holy Angels Residential Facility.

image.alt: Jason B. Cope, DDS, PhD, FACD

paragraphs.text: Jason B. Cope, DDS, PhD, FACD, brings decades of clinical experience and research to the practice. He has published extensively and lectured internationally, and he applies research-driven protocols to improve clinical outcomes for patients.

Dr. Cope earned his dental degree, orthodontic certificate, and a PhD in craniofacial bone biology from Baylor College of Dentistry. He practiced in Dallas for many years, leading clinical research that produced new protocols and patented products, and has authored numerous journal articles and textbook chapters.
A prolific speaker and educator, Dr. Cope has delivered hundreds of presentations worldwide and continues to bring evidence-based advances into everyday orthodontic care.

Dr. Cope recently returned to the local area to raise his family. He and his wife Laura, who is also an orthodontist, are raising two children, Izzie and Luca. He values community engagement and bringing advanced, research-backed care to his patients.

paragraphs.text: Foster Orthodontics regularly participates in local events and sponsorships and curates photos in the Foster Community gallery. Our doctors and staff support area organizations and volunteer initiatives, and we take pride in giving back to the communities we serve.

og_meta.title: About Us | Foster Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Learn about Foster Orthodontics' family-focused, patient-centered care. Call (318) 750-2762 or visit our contact page to schedule.

image.alt: Smiling family welcomed at Foster Orthodontics front desk

paragraphs.text: Welcome to our office. We look forward to meeting you and talking with you about your orthodontic concerns. We have set aside special time to evaluate your needs, answer your questions, and discuss treatment options. There is no charge for this initial appointment; please allow about one hour. Dr. Foster will use digital imaging during your visit, and when time allows our records team can gather additional diagnostic materials so we can proceed efficiently.

We will review your medical history and create a custom treatment plan. Fees vary by individual need, and we will review insurance and payment options during your visit. Call us at (318) 750-2762 to schedule your free consultation.

image.alt: Parent and child checked in at Foster Orthodontics reception

paragraphs.text: We accept most major insurance plans and will file claims electronically to make the process easier for you.
We offer in-house, interest-free financing and flexible payment plans. Our treatment coordinator will help you find an option that fits your budget.
For your convenience, you can print your patient forms at home and bring them to your first visit, or access and submit forms online before your appointment to save time.

image.alt: Patient filling out orthodontic health history forms online

image.alt: Bright modern orthodontic treatment area with smiling patients and staff

paragraphs.text: Traditional metal braces remain a reliable, effective option, while ceramic braces give a more discreet look. Our team customizes bracket types and schedules to balance comfort and results.

image.alt: Close-up of orthodontic braces on patient teeth

paragraphs.text: Clear aligners offer a discreet, comfortable way to straighten teeth for teens and adults. They are removable for meals and cleaning and are planned precisely using digital scans.

image.alt: Clear aligner trays displayed on a white backdrop

paragraphs.text: We offer Invisalign<sup>®</sup> as a precise, comfortable option for many patients. Custom 3D planning and removable trays make oral hygiene and everyday life easier during treatment.
Request a consultation to see if Invisalign<sup>®</sup> is a good fit for your smile goals; our doctors will explain the process and expected timeline.

image.alt: Close-up of a clear aligner being held over teeth

paragraphs.text: The Damon System uses self-ligating brackets to reduce friction and often shorten treatment time. Many patients appreciate fewer adjustments and a comfortable, efficient experience.
From routine adjustments to complex cases, our practice provides complete orthodontic care for children, teens, and adults using modern diagnostics and individualized treatment plans.

image.alt: Orthodontic team consulting with a patient in a treatment room

paragraphs.text: Early evaluation, often around age seven, helps us guide jaw growth and simplify or avoid more extensive treatment later. Early steps can lead to gentler, shorter care as your child grows.

image.alt: Young child having an orthodontic evaluation in a bright clinic

paragraphs.text: We offer teen-friendly options and flexible scheduling to keep school and activities on track. Clear aligners and discreet ceramic braces are popular with adolescent patients.

image.alt: Two stylish smiling teens taking a selfie while in treatment

paragraphs.text: Adults benefit from discreet options and treatment plans that fit busy lives. We provide clear aligners, ceramic braces, and flexible financing so adult patients get great results without major disruption.

image.alt: Adult patient smiling while holding a clear retainer

image.alt: Orthodontic team consulting with a patient in a bright clinic

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about orthodontics, retainers, and scheduling at our office.

Orthodontics helps to improve the comfort of the bite, make it easier to brush and floss your teeth for good dental health, and many times helps to balance the facial musculature. The positive self-esteem benefits are immeasurable.

accordion.header: How do enlarged adenoids and allergies affect braces?

paragraphs.text: Mouth breathing, as a result of enlarged adenoids or tonsils or allergies, may cause your upper and lower jaws to grow apart and elongate facial form during growth, resulting in crowding and often narrow dental arches.

accordion.header: How does a tongue thrust or low tongue posture affect braces?

paragraphs.text: The effects are similar to enlarged adenoids. Plus, the pressure on the front teeth from the tongue thrusting can increase dental protrusion and spacing.

accordion.header: Do retainers need to be worn after braces?

paragraphs.text: Yes. Retainers are worn full-time for about 9 months followed by nighttime wear indefinitely.

accordion.header: Why do teeth get crooked after treatment?

paragraphs.text: Teeth move throughout life whether you have worn braces or not. It is part of the natural aging process. This is why retainer wear is recommended indefinitely to maintain your orthodontic results over your lifetime.

accordion.header: How about retainers glued to the back of the teeth?

paragraphs.text: For most patients, permanent retainers are attached to the back of the lower teeth to keep them in place. This requires special hygiene procedures and regular recalls to the family dentist.
